nodes.speaker: Hel
nodes.text: So, you’re the one Loki dragged in from the frost. Tell me—do you not bow when you enter the presence of Hel herself, or has the cold stolen even that much sense?

nodes.speaker: Hel
nodes.text: Good. A rare instinct—respect. Stand. And remember: mercy is not the same thing as warmth.

nodes.speaker: Hel
nodes.text: Mm. Proud. Or foolish. In Dreadheim, the difference is measured in scars.

nodes.speaker: Hel
nodes.text: Do not mistake warmth for mercy, {name}. In Dreadheim, even the hearth has teeth. Speak—what do you want?

nodes.speaker: Hel
nodes.text: Bold. Loud. Dangerous. Dreadheim likes that—until it doesn’t. Sit, then. Let the hall measure you.

nodes.speaker: Hel
nodes.text: Silent. Careful. The kind who survives storms by becoming one. Fine—stand there and listen.

nodes.speaker: Hel
nodes.text: Watch the benches. The ones who smile first are usually hungry. And you… you have the look of someone deciding what they can get away with.

choices.label: Wait until Hel isn’t looking and steal her amulet.

nodes.speaker: Hel
nodes.text: …Interesting. Either you are very brave… or very stupid. That amulet is old hunger given form. Keep it—if you can live with what follows you now.

nodes.speaker: Hel
nodes.text: Flattery in Dreadheim is either a weapon or a confession. …Still. You chose words instead of claws. That tells me something.

nodes.speaker: Hel
nodes.text: Loki likes debts. So do I. If you want to wear Dreadheim’s mark, you will earn it in choices—small ones that rot or shine over time.
